perturbation.original_text:
Maintenance Services 
No-charge Maintenance Services shall be provided from the Delivery Date through the Warranty Period. The first paid (Initial) Maintenance Term
shall commence upon expiration of the Warranty Period and shall continue for twelve (12) months thereafter. Thereafter, the Maintenance Term shall
automatically renew for successive period, 12 months, on the terms and conditions of this Agreement unless Bank of America terminates
Maintenance Services pursuant to this Agreement. Bank of America may terminate Maintenance Services for convenience at any time in
accordance with the Section entitled “Termination” of the Agreement. If Bank of America terminates the Maintenance Services, Bank of America
shall have the right to reinstate the Maintenance Services without paying any reinstatement fee. During the initial Maintenance Term and any
renewal term, Maintenance Fees shall be paid in the increments described below under “Payment Terms.”
perturbation.changed_text:
Maintenance Services 
No-charge Maintenance Services shall be provided from the Delivery Date through the Warranty Period. The first paid (Initial) Maintenance Term
shall commence upon expiration of the Warranty Period and shall continue for twelve (12) months thereafter. Thereafter, the Maintenance Term shall
automatically renew for successive period, 12 months, on the terms and conditions of this Agreement unless Bank of America terminates
Maintenance Services pursuant to this Agreement. Bank of America may terminate Maintenance Services for convenience at any time in
accordance with the Section entitled “Termination” of the Agreement. If Bank of America terminates the Maintenance Services, Bank of America
shall have the right to reinstate the Maintenance Services without paying any reinstatement fee. During the initial Maintenance Term and any
renewal term, Maintenance Fees MAY be paid in the increments described below under “Payment Terms.”
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall' to 'may' regarding Maintenance Fees creates ambiguity. The original text implies an obligation to pay maintenance fees, whereas the modified text suggests it is optional, potentially contradicting other clauses relating to payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
The Software License and Maintenance will be provided at no charge.
perturbation.changed_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
The Software License will be provided at no charge. Maintenance services may incur charges based on usage.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction. The original text states that both Software License and Maintenance are provided at no charge. The changed text retains the 'no charge' for the Software License but introduces the possibility of charges for Maintenance, which contradicts the initial statement, and previous section about maintenance fees.

perturbation.changed_text:
WARRANTY
PERIOD
DURATION
Delivery Date:

TBD

Installation Date:

TBD

The period commencing on the
Installation Date and continuing for the
number of days specified:

120 days

Notwithstanding anything set forth
elsewhere in this Agreement (or below),
the Maintenance Period will be defined in a subsequent amendment.

120 days
perturbation.explanation: The text modification removes the explicit definition of the Maintenance Period duration (24/7 including holidays), replacing it with a vague statement about a 'subsequent amendment'. This creates an inconsistency because the original 120-day warranty period is still referenced, but the maintenance period is now undefined, leading to uncertainty in enforcement. Other sections referring to the Maintenance Period are now ambiguous without the defined duration.
